section.description: While Alpha Anywhere offers a powerful letter writer for creating mail merge Letters, in some instances, you might prefer to generate mail merge Letters using Microsoft Word.
section.note: You can merge Memo fields, but you cannot merge:

case.description: Calculated fields placed on a form

step.description: When viewing a form or browse, click the word 'W' icon or select Tools > Mail merge with Word to display the Microsoft Word Merge dialog box.
Click New Word Template and OK to open Microsoft Word.
Make sure that all table fields are mapped correctly. Click the following to display the Match Fields dialog box.
For each field in the left-hand column that you want to use, select the table field from the corresponding combo box on the right.
Click OK to return to the process of creating your template.
Enter text and fields from Alpha Anywhere. To place a field in the document, click the following to display the Insert Merge Field dialog.
Select the field from the list box and click Insert. In a similar manner you can click one of the following to insert Address Blocks or Greeting Lines.
If you wish to review, sort, or edit the selected list of records, click the following to display the Mail Merge Recipients dialog box.
When the template is finished, save it to file, close Microsoft Word, and return to Alpha Anywhere.
Select Tools > Mail merge with Word to display the Microsoft Word Merge dialog box.
Click Manage List.
Click the green '+' Add Template to display the Add Template dialog box.
Enter a name for the template in the Descriptive name field.
Click the 'open folder' icon to navigate to and select the new Word template document.
Click OK > OK to conclude.
Select Tools > Mail merge with Word to display the Microsoft Word Merge dialog box.
Select the template you wish to use.
Select either Current record only or All records in current query.
Click OK to start the merge process.
